Sentencas: In this study, the effects of Fe, Mn, Ni, and Ti dopants on the densification, phase structure, microstructure, and electrical conductivity of the La9.5Ge6.0O26.25 ceramics were examined.
Titulo: Transition metal-doped lanthanum germanate apatites as electrolyte materials of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: After sintering, the La9.5Ge5.5Mn0.5O26 and La9.5Ge5.5Ti0.5O26.25 ceramics displayed hexagonal symmetry while the La9.5Ge5.5Ni0.5O25.75 and La9.5Ge5.5Fe0.5O26 ceramics produced triclinic lattice.
Titulo: Transition metal-doped lanthanum germanate apatites as electrolyte materials of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The La9.5Ge5.5Fe0.5O26 ceramic sintered at 1400 degrees C showed the best electrical conductivity of 0.033 Scm(-1) and the lowest densification temperature among the apatite ceramics evaluated, and the calculated thermal expansion coefficient of this system emerged to be 10.5 x 10(-6) K-1, compatible with those of the common adjacent materials used in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Transition metal-doped lanthanum germanate apatites as electrolyte materials of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Single cells of NiO-SDC/La9.5Ge5.5Fe0.5O26/LSCF-SDC were built and evaluated.
Titulo: Transition metal-doped lanthanum germanate apatites as electrolyte materials of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The open circuit voltages of the single cell read 0.96 and 1.01 V respectively at 950 and 800 degrees C, both in accord with the redicted theoretical values and verifying the pure ionic conduction in apatites.
Titulo: Transition metal-doped lanthanum germanate apatites as electrolyte materials of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The maximum power densities (MPDs) of the single cell were 0.384, 0.280, 0.201, and 0.125 Wcm(-2) respectively at the measurement temperatures of 950, 900, 450, and 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Transition metal-doped lanthanum germanate apatites as electrolyte materials of solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The MPDs of the single cell with the La9.5Ge5.5Fe0.5O26 electrolyte are superior to those of the SOFCs with apatite ceramics as electrolyte previously reported in the literature, thereby testifying to the potential of the La9.5Ge5.5Fe0.5O26 ceramic as a promising electrolyte material for SOFCs.
Titulo: Transition metal-doped lanthanum germanate apatites as electrolyte materials of solid oxide fuel cells
Transition metal-doped lanthanum germanate apatites as electrolyte materials of solid oxide fuel cells
Transition metal-doped lanthanum germanate apatites as electrolyte materials of solid oxide fuel cells
